detaileddescription.para: Returns BUSY when API is busy with a previous request
Returns ERROR when API cannot fulfil request

memberdef.argsstring: (const XMC_FCE_t *const engine, const uint16_t *data, uint32_t length, uint16_t *result)
memberdef.name: XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC16

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
Pointer to the data buffer
Length of data buffer
Pointer to computed CRC result

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Calculate and update the RC16 checksum in the result pointer

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: A write to Internal Register (IRm m = 2) triggers the CRC kernel to update the message checksum according to the IR and current CRC register contents. Only 32-bit or 16-bit write transactions are permitted. Any other bus write transaction will lead to a bus error. Only the lower 16-bit of the write transactions will be used. XMC_FCE_GetCRCResult() should be called after XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC16() to get final CRC value.

memberdef.argsstring: (const XMC_FCE_t *const engine, const uint8_t *data, uint32_t length, uint16_t *const result)
memberdef.name: XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC16Ex

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
Pointer to the data buffer
Length of data buffer
Pointer to computed CRC result

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Calculate and update the RC16 checksum in the result pointer

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: Alternative to XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC16() where a uint8_t data array can be used

memberdef.argsstring: (const XMC_FCE_t *const engine, const uint32_t *data, uint32_t length, uint32_t *result)
memberdef.name: XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC32

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
Pointer to the data buffer
Total number of bytes of data buffer
Pointer to computed CRC result

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Calculate and update the calculated CRC32 checksum in the result pointer

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: A write to Internal Register (IRm, m = 0-1) triggers the CRC kernel to update the message checksum according to the IR and current CRC register contents. Only 32-bit write transactions are permitted. Any other bus write transaction will lead to a bus error. XMC_FCE_GetCRCResult() should be called after XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC32() to get final CRC value.

memberdef.argsstring: (const XMC_FCE_t *const engine, const uint8_t *data, uint32_t length, uint32_t *const result)
memberdef.name: XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC32Ex

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
Pointer to the data buffer
Total number of bytes of data buffer
Pointer to computed CRC result

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Calculate and update the calculated CRC32 checksum in the result pointer

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: Alternative to XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC32() where a uint8_t data array can be used

memberdef.argsstring: (const XMC_FCE_t *const engine, const uint8_t *data, uint32_t length, uint8_t *result)
memberdef.name: XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC8

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
Pointer to the data buffer
Total number of bytes of data buffer
Pointer to computed CRC result

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Calculate and updates the CRC8 checksum in the result pointer

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: A write to IRm (m = 3) triggers the CRC kernel to update the message checksum according to the IR and current CRC register contents. Any write transaction is allowed to this IRm register. Only the lower 8-bit of the write transactions will be used. XMC_FCE_GetCRCResult() should be called after invoking XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC8() to get final CRC value.

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
Event of type XMC_FCE_STS_FLAG_t

simplesect.para: The function clears requested FCE events by setting the bit-fields of the STS register.
The function asserts the FCE peripheral reset and sets the DISR bit in the CLC register.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: All pending transactions running on the bus slave interface must be completed before entering the disabled state.

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
A valid algorithm of type XMC_FCE_CONFIG_ALGO_t or a valid combination of logically OR'd algorithms

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: Options for disabling CRC algorithm: REFIN: Input byte wise reflection REFOUT: Output bit wise reflection XSEL: Value to be XORed with final CRC

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
OR'd values of XMC_FCE_CONFIG_INTERRUPT_t enumeration values

simplesect.para: The function clears the CFG register to disable FCE event(s).

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
FCE operation of type XMC_FCE_CONFIG_OPERATION_t

simplesect.para: The function disables FRC operations by writing to the CFG register.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: CRC comparison check (at the end of message) can be disabled using the CCE bit-field. Automatic reload of LENGTH field (at the end of message) can be disabled using the ALR bit field.
The function de-asserts the peripheral reset and clears the DISR bit CLC register.

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
A valid algorithm of type XMC_FCE_CONFIG_ALGO_t or a valid combination of logically OR'd algorithms

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: Options for enabling CRC algorithm: REFIN: Input byte wise reflection REFOUT: Output bit wise reflection XSEL: Value to be XORed with final CRC

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
OR'd values of XMC_FCE_CONFIG_INTERRUPT_t enumeration values

simplesect.para: The function sets the CFG register to enable FCE event(s).

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
FCE operation of type XMC_FCE_CONFIG_OPERATION_t

simplesect.para: The function enables FRC operations by writing to the CFG register.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: CRC comparison check (at the end of message) can be enabled using the CCE bit-field. Automatic reload of LENGTH field (at the end of message) can be enabled using the ALR bit field.
The function reads the FCE module disable status (DISS) bit. It returns "true" if set, "false" otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
Pointer to CRC result

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Read the final CRC value from RES register

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
Event of type XMC_FCE_STS_FLAG_t

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Return the event status of FCE event
The function returns the status of a single requested FCE event by reading the appropriate bit-fields of the STS register.

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address

simplesect.para: The function sets to the CFG and CRC registers with the FCE configuration and seeds values. The function always returns XMC_FCE_STATUS_SUCCESS.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: The software must first ensure that the CRC kernel is properly configured with the initial CRC value (seed value).

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
Initial CRC value

simplesect.para: The function sets the initial CRC (seed) value in the CRC register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to input data buffer
Pointer to the output data buffer
Length of the input buffer

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Convert input data buffer's endianness from big endian to little endian
The function stores the converted data in output data buffer.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: This function should be invoked before using XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC16() to compute the CRC value.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to input data buffer
Pointer to the output data buffer
Length of the input buffer

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Convert input data buffer's endianness from big endian to little endian
The function stores the converted data in output data buffer.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: This function should be invoked before using XMC_FCE_CalculateCRC32() to compute the CRC value.
The return value for FCE module is currently 0x00CA.
The value of a module revision starts with 0x01 (first revision). The current revision number is 0x01.
The return value is currently 0xC0. It defines the module as a 32-bit module.

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
values of type XMC_FCE_CTR_TEST_t

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Trigger the CTR register to generate a CRC mismatch/register mismatch/check register mismatch interrupt

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
Checksum value

simplesect.para: When the CFG.CCE bit field is set, every time the IR register is written, the LENGTH register is decremented by one until it reaches zero. The hardware monitors the transition of the LENGTH register from 1 to 0 to detect the end of the message and proceed with the comparison of the result register (RES) value with the CHECK register value.

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to XMC_FCE_t, pointing to the FCE base address
Checksum length

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Updates CRC length specified in the input parameter

When the ALR bit field is set to 1, every write to the IR register decrements the value of the LENGTH bit field. The LENGTH field shall be reloaded with its configuration value at the end of the cycle where LENGTH reaches 0.

briefdescription.para: Flexible CRC Engine(FCE) driver for the XMC microcontroller family.

detaileddescription.para: The FCE provides a parallel implementation of Cyclic Redundancy Code (CRC) algorithms. The current FCE version for the XMC4000 microcontroller family implements the IEEE 802.3 ethernet CRC32, the CCITT CRC16 and the SAE J1850 CRC8 polynomials. The primary target of FCE is to be used as an hardware acceleration engine for software applications or operating systems services using CRC signatures.

FCE Features:
CRC kernel 0 and 1: IEEE 802.3 CRC32 ethernet polynomial: 0x04C11DB71
CRC kernel 2: CCITT CRC16 polynomial: 0x1021
CRC kernel 3: SAE J1850 CRC8 polynomial: 0x1D
Configuration Registers enable to control the CRC operation and perform automatic checksum checks at the end of a message.
Extended register interface to control reliability of FCE execution in safety applications.
Error notification scheme via dedicated interrupt node for: a)Transient error detection: Error interrupt generation (maskable) with local status register (cleared by software) b)Checksum failure: Error interrupt generation (maskable) with local status register (cleared by software)
FCE provides one interrupt line to the interrupt system. Each CRC engine has its own set of flag registers.
